intro: Sobralia flava, commonly known as the yellow sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually elongated and arranged in a rosette pattern, facilitating efficient water retention. Sobralia flava is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
